GROUP 1. MINUTE BOOKS AND JOURNALS
Minute Books 1945-1965.

Minute Book 1945-54. Executive, General meetings. Commences with the formation in February 1945 of a Victorian Branch of AFSA, despite opposition from the WWF; 1946 agreement with shipowners; relations with WWF and the Federated Ship Painters and Dockers' Union of Australia; affiliation with the ACTU and ALP; Federal log of claims 1949; 1950 affiliation with THC. 1 vol. 286pp. 27 Feb. 1945 - 29 Jan. 1954.
Minutes, Special Meetings 1958-1961. Re margins, long service leave, disputes on the waterfront, workers' compensation, campaign for wet weather clothing. 1 vol. 1958 - 1961.
Minute Book. Executive and Special Meetings 1961-1965. Contains material on long service leave campaign.
Diaries, Journals
Secretary's Diary, 1951-1965. Bound volumes of notes re union management: union elections, contributions, arrangements for meetings, minutes of meetings, newspaper cuttings. 16 vols. 1951 - 1965.
Casual foremen's journal. 1 vol. 1962.
GROUP 2. MANAGEMENT
Rules

Typescript of the 1956 rules of AFSA (Vic. Branch). Includes both General Rules and rules for the administration of the branch. Among Association's purposes are: obtaining proper rates of pay, promotion of industrial peace by means of conciliation and arbitration, and to "further political objects". Contains clauses governing members' conduct in a strike of another organisation. 40pp. 1 Jan. 1956.
Rules of AFSA 72pp. 1 Jan. 1957.
Draft of 1965 Branch rules adopted at a Special General Meeting. Halves entrance fee, lowers annual subscription. 16pp. 2 copies. 26 Jan. 1966.
Applications for membership

Applications 1945-51. Loose-leaf volume of applications arranged in alphabetical order, which contains details re employment permanent/casual, length of time in industry, former union to which applicant belonged. The majority were former members of WWF. 3 vols. 1945 - 1951.
Applications. 1 vol. 1952 - 1956.
Ditto. 1 vol and envelope. 1957-1968.
Membership registers

Register of members. Vic. Branch. Contains an alphabetical list of union members with addresses and notes re change of address, transfers, resignations, deaths, etc. Includes a list of 1960 executive. 1 vol. 1960.
Register of casual foremen. Contains rates of pay for permanent/casual work, lists of the 1962, 1965 executives, subscriptions for 1963. 1 vol. 1965 - 1969.
Accounts
Ledger. Financial statements re union members listed alphabetically. Includes details concerning payment of dues, receipts, transfers, resignations, deaths, etc. 1 vol. 1945 - 1953.
GROUP 2.
MANAGEMENT (cont.)
Accounts (cont.)
Manual of accounts, accounting procedure and instructions, items to be adjusted. 7pp. t.s. 1952.
Day Book. Contains lists of receipts of membership dues, expenditure, annual balance sheets, lists of trade creditors. 1 vol. plus loose sheets. 1945 - 1952.
Journals. Re subscriptions, receipts, expenditure, 2 vols. 1952 - 1953.
Cash Book. Payments to various organisations, such as ALP, THC. 1 vol. 1952 - 1958.
Commonwealth Savings Bank, Melbourne. Statements of ASFA (Vic. Branch) and Death Benefit Fund accounts. 1 small bundle. 1951 - 1959.
Miscellaneous
Miscellaneous
'Phone numbers of casual foremen. 1p. 1 Nov. 1962.
List of financial members. AFSA (Vic. Branch) 6pp. 1 Jan. 1964.
Lists of foremen who died, left the industry, were transferred or retired, during 1964. 1p. 1964.
Results of 1964 union election 3pp. 2 - 6 March 1964.
Annual Report and balance sheet. 4pp. 1965.
List of executive. 1p. 1965.
Casual foremen. Lists names, addresses, telephone numbers. 1p. July 1965.
List of financial members. 9pp. 1965.
List of Victorian branch members. 9pp. Undated.
GROUP 3.
CORRESPONDENCE
Members' Correspondence
Members' correspondence, circulars. Concerns resignations, transfers, admissions, notice of meetings. 1 bundle. 1946 - 1964.

The case of Angus MacDonald. Concerns his appeal to the British Ex-Service Council of Australasia for assistance against the alleged victimisation of R. Scott, Secretary, AFSA. Concludes with his explusion from the union. 1 bundle. 5 Aug. 1959 - 29 March 1963.
Notices of meetings, memos to foremen, casual foremen and executive members. 1 bundle. 1960 - 1965.
Applications for membership, transfers and resignations. 1 bundle. 9 Oct. 1963 - 25 Aug. 1965.

Between Branches Note: concerns negotiations for awards and agreements, relations between AFSA and WWF and with shipowners' organisations during the period 1945 - 1964. The main correspondents are: R. Scott, Vic. A.J. Munro, ) S.T. Thompson ) N.S.W. A. Hains ) F. Taylor ) R. Lloyd. ) L. Nash ) Tas. F. Bryce H. Davies, Adel.
Thompson to Scott. Re transfer 1p. 19 March 1945.

Scott to Thompson. Informs him that Scott has written to Overseas Steamship Representatives' Association, Australian Steamship Owners' Association and Master Stevedores' Association. Re formation of AFSA (Vic. Branch). 1p. 23 April 1945.
Lloyd to Scott. Says Thompson has asked him to forward copies of a Wages Board determination to Vic. Branch. 1p. 15 May 1945.
Thompson to Scott. Re letter from Scott about Thompson's attitude to J. Healey and WWF. Says that in Sydney a member must resign from WWF before he may join AFSA. 2pp. 16 May 1945.
GROUP 3.
CORRESPONDENCE (cont.)
Between Branches (cont.)
Hains to Scott. Re conference. Telegram. 23 May 1945.
Lloyd to Scott. Will send copies of the award. 1p. 25 May 1945.
Ditto. re inaccuracies in conference report concerning the definition of a foreman stevedore. 3pp. 1 June 1945.

Munro to Scott. Encloses for discussion by Vic. Branch a copy of a log of claims compiled by his branch, the final copy of which is to be submitted to the Federal Court as a proposed award to cover all Australian ports. 1p. 5 June 1945.
Lloyd to Scott. Re Tasmanian award in which the Wages Board granted a shipowners' determination. 4pp. (2 sheets). 20 June 1945.
Munro to Scott. Re conference, correspondence with other branches. 2pp. 6 July 1945.
Lloyd to Scott. Re conference, rates of pay for foremen stevedores etc. 11pp. 7 July 1945.
Munro to Scott. Re Townsville, Brisbane, Cairns, Mackay and Bowen branches. 2pp. 10, 11 July 1945.
Scott to Davies. Concerns the formation of an Adelaide branch. 3pp. 10 July 1945.
R.J. Jolley, South Yarra, to Scott. Resigns as minute secretary of Vic. Branch. 1p. 11 July 1945.
Unsigned letter to Scott. Concerns arrangements for a suitable meeting place for casual foremen at WWF premises. 2pp. (1 sheet) 12 July 1945.
GROUP 3.
CORRESPONDENCE (cont.)
Between Branches (cont.)
Munro to Scott. Re conference, hiring rooms for delegates, meeting with shipowners, etc. 2pp. 17 July 1945.
H. Heyen, Treasurer, Vic. Branch, to Scott. Tenders his resignation and offers his services as minute secretary. 1p. 30 July 1945.
Munro to Scott. Forwards copy of president's report and minutes of Federal Executive. Speaks of peace settlement. 1p. 17 Aug.1945.
Hains to Scott. Says peace celebrations have caused disruption and so has not had an executive meeting since the conference. 2pp. 19 Aug. 1945.

Munro to Scott. Asks if he has received copies of the reports and minutes of meetings forwarded to him. Encloses two further copies of reports and asks Scott to forward six copies of the log of claims put before the shipowners. 1p. 27 Aug. 1945.
Hains to Scott. Speaks of resentment and opposition by the Vic. Branch towards the WWF but says he thinks it can be overcome. 2pp. 31 Aug. 1945.
Lloyd to Scott. Refers to Thompson's resignation. Asks if he has heard from shipowners yet. Speaks of a general election and inquires if he has had more clashes with the WWF. 3pp. 6 Sept. 1945.
Munro to Scott. Re charges made by WWF against AFSA. Discusses possible formation of a Newcastle branch. 2pp. 21 Sept. 1945.
Hains to Scott. Concerns a federal conference with shipowners to discuss a federal agreement, election of federal officers, etc. 2pp. 24 Sept. 1945.
Ditto. Confidential. Tells of his urgent message to the Central Committee of CSOA. Says he has not received a reply yet. 1p. 9 Oct. 1945.
GROUP 3.
CORRESPONDENCE (cont.)
Between Branches (cont.)
Ditto. Re reply from R. Vienvenue, CSOA 1p. 12 Oct. 1945.
Lloyd to Scott. Asks for information about the award. 2pp. 12 Oct. 1945.

Ditto. Thanks him for letter and apologizes for his impatience. Speaks of trouble with casual foremen, who are still members of the WWF. Thanks him for information about the award. Suggests an earlier meeting with the Federal Executive. 4pp. 18 Oct.1945.
Lloyd to Scott. Re agreement for Victoria. Asks for a copy and says he is concerned about the preference clause. 3pp. 22 Nov. 1945.

Ditto. Acknowledges receipt of a copy of the proposed agreement. Says that apart from the weekly wage of 19 pounds and the payment of meal money, he considers it "lousy". Points out that there is no limitation of overtime, and annual leave only after a 3 year probation period. Criticises definitions. 6pp. 5 Dec. 1945.
Hains to Scott. Discusses the agreement. 2pp. 10 Dec. 1945.

Lloyd to Scott. Encloses a list of branch members. Discusses the possibility of reaching a temporary agreement with the Oversea and Interstate Joint Shipping Committee in Hobart. Asks how the Victorian temporary agreement is working. Speaks of the attitude of shipowners. 7pp. 2 Jan. 1946.

Ditto. Speaks of an interview with the chairman of the Oversea and Interstate Joint Shipping Committee. Says he will refer the Victorian agreement to the Tasmanian Committee but not recommend it. Wants to know if the agreement is in operation in Melbourne. 3pp. 7 Jan. 1946.
J. Otley, Secretary, Townsville Branch, to Scott. Telegram. Requets immediate information about an award or agreement. 14 Jan. 1946.
Hains to Scott. Re meeting of the Federal Executive in Sydney.1p. 22 Feb. 1946.
GROUP 3. CORRESPONDENCE (cont.)

Lloyd to Scott. More re temporary agreement. Asks if he has any information about a Tasmanian agreement and suggests that he may find out by interviewing Vienvenue, COSA. Says his members are very dissatisfied with their working conditions. 3pp. 24 Feb. 1946.
Hains to Scott. Commends him for arranging a conference between Victorian Committee and WWF and speaks of the Federal Committee's meeting with the Federal body of the WWF. 2pp. 25 Feb. 1946.

Lloyd to Scott. Speaks again of the possibility of securing a temporary agreement for Tasmania. Says he is of the opinion that the shipowners are grasping at any straw to delay the agreement coming into operation. Speaks of the need for casual foremen to sever all connections with the WWF. 4pp. 27 Feb. 1946.

Ditto. Says that he now has proof that the shipowners have no intention of entering into any temporary agreements until they see where they stand in relation to the new Shipping Industry Commission. 4pp. 6 March 1946.
Munro to Scott. Re Federal conference. 1p. 15 March 1946.

E.P. Mullins, Cairns branch, to Hains. Encloses a letter forwarded to Scott which has been returned to him re closer co-operation with the WWF. Explains that ten out of thirteen members of his branch are financial members of WWF. 3pp. 17 Feb. - 18 March 1946.
Hains to Mullins. Re letter to Scott. Says he is gratified that there are no problems between AFSA and WWF in Cairns. Re Federal agreement, conference. 2pp. 20 March 1946.
Hains to Scott. Encloses a copy of correspondence with Vienvenue, CSOA re information supplied to Lloyd. Also encloses a letter concerning a transfer. 2pp. 21 March 1946.

Lloyd to Scott. Gives further evidence that the shipowners are not playing the game. Explains that he is endeavouring to get an interview with the Premier concerning reaching an amicable agreement with the shipowners. 7pp. 23 March 1946.
GROUP 3. CORRESPONDENCE (cont.)
Between Branches (cont.)
Ditto. Re conference between Tasmanian shipowners and AFSA. Hopes it won't clash with the Sydney conference.3pp. 25 March 1946.
Munro to Scott. Re Federal conference.1p 3 April 1946.
Scott to Hains. Two urgent telegrams. Says Captain Long has refused leave to Victorian delegates to attend the Sydney conference. Undated.
Hains to Scott. Telegram re above. Urges Scott to use his influence to overcome obstacles. 4 April 1946.
T. Heritage, Adelaide branch, to Scott. Telegram. Re Clerks' Union application before State Court, to change its constitution to cover employees supervising, sorting, stacking cargo. 4 April 1946.
Scott to Heritage. Urgent telgram. Re Federal conference. Undated.
Lloyd to Scott. Concerns a conference with the shipowners. 1p. 26 April 1946.
Ditto. Asks if there are any shorthand notes of the conference. Inquires about the situation in Fremantle. Speaks of a proposed agreement. 3pp. 23 May 1946.

Ditto. Encloses a list of Tasmanian officials/members, copy of rules and constitution and a statutory declaration. Talks of the possible hostility of NSW and Queensland to a Federal agreement, as they are satisfied with their existing awards. 6pp. 31 May 1946.
Ditto. Private correspondence. Argues that until AFSA is registered with the Arbitration Court, branches outside NSW will have no standing. 5pp. 5 June 1946..

Ditto. Says he has put Vienvenue memo before Tasmanian members and they are disappointed about not getting an award. Refers to a remark of Healey's about a possible affiliation of AFSA with the WWF. 3pp. 28 June 1946.
GROUP 3. CORRESPONDENCE (cont.)
Between Branches (cont.)

Hains to Scott. Concerns resolution of the Sydney branch executive re a log of claims to be presented to the Arbitration Court and interim State agreements. Suggests that the AFSA Federal office be transferred to Sydney. 66pp. 3 July 1946.

Lloyd to Scott. Re recent conference. Says the Northern delegates from NSW and Queensland are not prepared to surrender anything to help the less fortunate states. Refers to the hostility of shipowners to the question of affiliation with the ALP and the Trades and Labour Council. Opposes it personally, because he thinks it would put foremen stevedores on the wrong side of the employer. 10pp. 4 July 1946.
Ditto. Re affiliation with WWF. 6pp. 6, 12 July 1946.

Ditto. Concerns the possibility of securing a Tasmanian agreement with the shipowners. Discusses clauses. Again speaks of the southern states being "dumped" by the northern states. Re possible affiliation with WWF. Says he does not want to affiliate with a "Communist controlled body". 13pp. 16 29 July 1946.
Ditto. Re changes in employment conditions in Hobart proposed by shipowners: Huddart Parker Ltd, Wm. Holyman and Sons, Union S.S. Co. 8pp. 30, 31 July, 1 Aug. 1946.

Ditto. Gives him a full history of the position of foremen in Hobart. Refers to a telegram from Hains urging him not to accept the new conditions until he gets legal advice and consulsts the WWF. 8pp. 3 Aug. 1946.

Ditto. Says his men won't accept the conditions. Encloses a copy of a letter sent to Hains concerning consultation with the WWF in the event of a stoppage. Says it will ruin negotiation: with the shipowners. 5pp. 5 Aug. 1946.
Lloyd's report on conference held in Melbourne with the Central Committee, CSOA, regarding pooling the services of foremen stevedores. 4pp. 14, 20, 22 Aug. 1946.
GROUP 3. CORRESPONDENCE (cont.)
Between Branches (cont.)
Statistics re voting strengths of norther, southern branches in Triennial Conferences and within the Federal conference. 2pp. Undated.
Lloyd to Scott. Re Holyman letter to foremen, reasons for shipowners pressing for a pooling scheme. 4pp. 27 Aug. 1946.
Ditto. Re Holyman's orders. Says he is going to interview Holyman and try to straighten out the matter. Encloses a report of an interview with Holyman's manager. 4pp. 29 Aug. 1946.
Scott to Ibyd. Urgent telegram. Re finalising agreement. Says Capt. Long has refused him permission to visit Tasmania. Undated.

Lloyd to Scott. Says he has some "extremely important and strictly confidential information" which he asks Scott not to discuss with his closest friends. Suggests he destroy this letter. Re Union S.S. Coy, Huddart Parker Ltd and Wm. Holyman forming themselves into the Hobart Stevedoring Company with 3 permanent foremen to hinder the Tasmanian award. 3pp. 18 Sept. 1946.
Taylor to Scott. Telegram. Re demarcation dispute with WWF. Undated.
Scott to Taylor. Replies to above. Undated.
Lloyd to Scott. Re acceptance of an agreement for 12 months. 3pp. 26 Sept. 1946.

AFSA circular to federal delegates. Concerns a decision to establish the federal office in Sydney. Asks for applications from financial members resident in that port to fulfill the duties of General Secretary in an honorary capacity. Submits 7 names and asks for votes. 1p. 21 Jan. 1947.
Taylor to Scott. Says that he has been in consultation with Healey about the possibility of a more amicable relationship with the WWF and AFSA in the Port of Melbourne. 1p. 30 Oct. 1947.
Hains Presidential Report 1948-9. To all State branches. Re struggle for better conditions. Compares wage rates during ten years 1939 to 1949. 3pp. 1948 - 1949.
GROUP 3. CORRESPONDENCE (cont.)
Between Branches (cont.)
Taylor to Scott. Telegram. Says the agreement should be implemented, filed in court and the preference clause granted soon. 3 Feb. 1950.
Bryce to Scott. Explains that he is now secretary of Port Adelaide branch in place of Heritage. 1p. 23 March 1951.
Scott to Taylor. Re marginal increase for all foremen covered by the Federal award. 1p. 3 Feb.1955.
Ditto. 1p. 14 Feb. 1955.
Ditto. Re margins. 1p. 19 Feb. 1955.
Scott to Bryce. Re stevedoring inquiry. 1p. 21 March 1955.
Scott to A. Bates, Tasmania. Re margins increase and the inquiry. 1p. 22 March 1955.
Scott to Taylor. Says he has been able to get two copies of transcript of Stevedoring Inquiry, Northern Tasmanian Agreement, Geelong Inquiry. 1p. 3 June 1955.
Ditto. Telegram. Says Tasmanian ports will not accept the proposed award. 14 July 1955.
Ditto. Re visit to Queensland. 1p. 14 July 1955.
Scott to Bates. Re Tasmanian award. 1p. 14 Dec. 1955.
Scott to W.R. Jackson, Devonport. Re award. 1p. 14 Dec. 1955.
Scott to E. Hodgson, Launceston, Ditto. 1p. 14 Dec. 1955.
GROUP 3. CORRESPONDENCE (cont.)
Between Branches (cont.)
Sydney Branch to Scott. Informs him that Taylor is away. 1p. 16 Jan. 1956.
Scott to Hodgson. Concerns the attitude of Australian Aluminium Production Commission to the award. 2pp. 10 Jan. 1956.
Scott to Taylor. Tells of a discussion with Albert Monk, ACTU, re the waterfront strike and exemptions. Says he will attend a conference of martime unions. 1p. 23 Jan. 1956.

Scott to Jackson, Devonport. Says that permanent stevedore foremen must join AFSA as well as WWF. Explains that he is busy with a waterfront strike and talks of a martime conference. 1p. 28 Jan. 1956.
Ditto. More re WWF strike. Speaks of a watersiders' return to work. 1p. 14 Feb. 1956.
Scott to Hodgson. Re a foreman not getting back pay and on conditions on Holyman's ships in Melbourne. 1p. 15 Feb. 1956.
Scott to Taylor. Speaks of a WWF letter re dispute over margins and other claims. 1p. 14 March 1956.
Scott to B. Rankin, W.A. Discusses the attitude of Fremantle WWF to foremen stevedores becoming members of AFSA. 1p. 25 May 1956.
Scott to Taylor. Concerns a basic wage increase, a special ACTU Congress to discuss the new waterfront Stevedoring Industry Act, WWF criticism of ACTU. 2pp. 10 June 1956.
Scott to Hodgson. Re conference between Australian Aluminium Production Commission and the ACTU, attended by reps. of WWF, AFSA, Ironworkers, etc. re working the Towar Maru. 2pp. 11 June 1956.
Scott to Taylor. Re conference and WWF. 1p. 11 June 1956.
Ditto. Concerns the Towar Maru 15 June 1956.
Scott to F. Price. S.A. Re new rates of pay for foremen stevedores. 1p. 7 Aug. 1956.
Between Branches (cont.)
Scott to C. Holden, Geelong. Ditto. 1p. 7 Aug. 1956.

Taylor to Scott. Concerns superintendents and supervisors in Oversea Company's application for registration as an industrial union of employees, now a registered body in N.S.W. AFSA has drawn up a consolidated set of claims. 2pp. 2 Sept. 1956.
Scott to Taylor. Re need for minimum payments to foremen stevedores in Melbourne and Geelong. 2pp. 3 Sept. 1956.
Ditto. Speaks of trouble with the Victorian Stevedoring Co. re not keeping to the award. 1p. 15 Dec. 1956.
Ditto. Re Victorian Executive's resolution not to pay Federal dues until the calling of a Federal conference. 1p. 7 Aug. 1957.
Ditto. Says that McIlwraith, McEarhern Ltd have given him a small room rent free at their Gear Store Offices, North Wharf, as a city office. 1p. 14 Aug. 1957.
Scott to Nash. Says Taylor is a liar to suggest that Scott thinks Tasmanian demands are impossible to achieve. 1p. 17 Aug.1957.
Scott to R. Morris, NSW. Re nomination for NSW representation on the Federal Council. 1p. 21 Sept. 1957.

Scott to Hodgson and W. Jackson, Devonport. Re letter from P.H. Goddard, Secretary, State Committee, Hobart, concerning withdrawal of present log of claims. Also 3 letters from S. Bates, Hobart, re submission of a new log of claims. 6pp. 28 March - 15 April 1958.

Scott to S. Bates. Asks if he has drawn up a new log of claims as Scott has had 50 copies of the proposed Tasmanian Agreement typed, duplicated and sent to all Tasmanian ports. Has also discussed it with employers in Launceston and Devonport. 1p. 12 May 1958.

Scott to H.A. Ward, Tasmania. Expresses pleasure that there have been no alterations in the log of claims lodged with Hobart employers. Says he is meeting representatives of the Direct Employers to discuss Victorian proposed new log of claims. 1p. 17 May 1958.
Between Branches (cont.)
Scott to Tasmanian representatives. Re basic wage increase and new log of claims. 4pp. 23 May 1958.
Scott to F. Price, S.A. Asks for news of his association. 1p. 24 May 1958.
Taylor to Scott. Telegram. Explains that Court matters necessitate alteration in the date of Federal conference. 11 June 1958.
Scott to Bates. Re Federal conference. 1p. 17 June 1958.
Scott to Bryce. Ditto. 1p. 17 June 1958.
Scott to Taylor. Ditto. 1p. 17 June 1958.
Hodgson to Scott. Asks him to convey to Federal Council the Tasmanian Branch's strong disapproval of shipowners attitude to the new log of claims. 1p. 13 Oct. 1958.
Scott to Ward. Re wages, annual leave, double shifts, industrial clothing, meal money, long service leave. 2pp. 14 Oct. 1958.
Scott to Jackson. Re new agreement. 1p. 16 Oct. 1958.
Scott to Hodgson. Points out that foremen stevedores are 100 per cent above the basic wage. 2pp. 17 Oct. 1958.
Scott to Jackson. Re 6pm to 9pm shift. 1p. 18 Nov. 1958.
Scott to Taylor. Concerns a WWF application for payment for Anzac Day, because it falls on Saturday. 1p. 11 Arpil 1959.
Taylor to Scott. Says the application for payment for Anzac Day applies only to casual foremen. 1p. 23 April 1959.
Scott to F. Price, S.A. Re increased margins for waterside workers. 1p. 29 Dec. 1959.
Between Branches (cont.)
Scott to Taylor. Concerns the margins question. 1p. 29 Dec. 1959.
Ditto. Re Industrial Registrar's decision about a court- controlled ballot. Encloses results. 2pp. 7 Feb. 1960.

Re admission of Cavill, Munro, casual foremen stevedores working for Coastal Stevedores Pty Ltd, Burnie, as members of AFSA. Contains letters re activities of employers and Tasmanian and Federal Branches of the union. 31pp. 9 May - 12 July 1960.
Taylor to Scott. Concerns an assault on L.P. Stanley, President, AFSA (Vic. Branch) by a member of WWF. 2pp. 3 June 1960.
Scott to Taylor. Says Victorian foremen are concerned about the decision of ASIA chairman not to de-register watersider who admitted striking a foreman. 1p. 8 June 1960.
Taylor to W. Jackson. Says there is no reason to refuse casual foremen admission to the union. 1p. 16 June 1960.
Taylor to Scott. Telegram. Re establishment of a branch in WA and acceptance of members of Foremen Stevedores Industrial Union of Workers of W.A. as a branch of AFSA. 18 July 1960.
Scott to Taylor. Re expenses of Federal President. 1p. 30 Oct.1960.
Ditto. Concerns foremen's refusal to issue wet weather clothing. Watchmen's Union threat to stop work if job is given to WWF. 2pp. 31 Oct. 1960.
Taylor to Scott. Telegram. Concerns election of federal officers. 7 Nov. 1960.
Scott to Taylor. Ditto. 1p. 8 Nov. 1960.
Taylor to Hodgson. Re federal elections. 1p. 14 Nov. 1960.
Between Branches (cont.)
Taylor to R.A. Chapman, S.A. Discusses the newly-formed WA Foremen's Association, which is affiliated with AFSA. 1p. 14 Nov. 1960.
Taylor to Scott. Re dferment of federal elections. 1p. 14 Nov. 1960.
Scott to Taylor. Ditto. 1p. 12 Dec. 1960.
Taylor to Scott. Ditto. 2pp. 19 Dec. 1960.
Scott to Taylor. Re WWF proposal to declare WA branch a bogus organisation. Discusses another assault by WWF member on a foreman. 1p. 28 Jan. 1961.
Ditto. Concerns ACTU attitude to WA branch. 2pp. 25 Feb. 1961.

Taylor to Scott. Re complaint by J. Healy, WWF, that AFSA application to the Commonwealth Court for an award covering Vic., S.A., Tas., and W.A. would embarrass the WWF in its application to WA State Court for an award for foremen in that State. Asks Taylor for his opinion on postponement of AFSA application. 2pp. 26 April 1961.
Scott to Taylor. Telegram. Votes no to postponement. 26 April 1961.
Ditto. Further opposition to postponement. 1p. 30 April 1961.
Ditto. Concerns State Industrial Court's rejection of WWF applications to stop employers dismissing WWF foremen stevedores if they don't become members of AFSA. 1p. 2 May 1961.
Ditto. Re postponement of AFSA log of claims. 1p. 3 May 1961.
Ditto. Concerns Vic. Branch meeting. 1p. 5 May 1961.
GROUP 3.
CORRESPONDENCE (cont.)
Between Branches (cont.)

Scott to Taylor. Re clearance. Discusses death of Bill Cooke, AFSA member from Geelong, and suspicion that it was the result of phostoxin gas tablets used by the Grain Elevators Board in the fumigation of bulk wheat at Geelong Refers to THC conference with shipowners, Australian Wheat Board, etc. Encloses newspaper clippings. 3pp. 20 May 1961.
Ditto. Re inquest into Cooke's death. 1p. 15 June 1961.
Ditto. Concerns AFSA representatives on Federal and State panel of the Accident Prevention Organisation. 1p. 6 Sept. 1961.
Ditto. Re twilight shifts, retrenchment by the United Stevedoring Co. 1p. 22 Nov. 1961.
Taylor to Scott. Telegram. Notes that Fremantle dispute settled in AFSA's favour re preference to AFSA members. 21 Dec. 1961.
Scott to Taylor. Discusses excess fares, travelling time, overalls for foremen stevedores. 1p. 6 Feb. 1962.
Ditto. Re WWF stop work meeting. 1p. 14 March 1962.

Ditto. Further reference to Angus MacDonald. Says he has taken the matter up with AFSA barrister, H.C. Curwen-Walker, who declares MacDonald is "an idiot, a darn fool and just a trouble- maker". Re MacDonald's statutory declaration that Scott has victimized him. 2pp. 26 April 1962.
Ditto. Encloses copy of statutory declaration and a letter from the British Ex-Service Council of Australasia. 2pp. 14 May 1962.
Ditto. Further discussion of Angus MacDonald. 3pp. 21, 22 May, 8 Aug. 1962.
Ditto. Concerns a federal conference in S.A. 2p. 24 Oct. 1962.
GROUP 3.
CORRESPONDENCE (cont.)
Between Branches (cont.)
Scott to R. Chapman, S.A. Re ACTU conference of affiliated unions to discuss 35 hour week, margins increase, long service leave. 1p. 22 Nov. 1962.
Scott to R. Renton. W.A. Re ACTU conference. 1p. 22 Nov. 1962.
Ditto. Concerns discussions with McIlwraith, McEachern Ltd re foremen's amenities at Fremantle. 1p. 22 Nov. 1962.
Ditto. Re Harry Hogan's plans to oppose Scott if he is elected as NSW Federal representative for the position of Federal president. 1p. 22 Nov. 1962.
Scott to Chapman. Re Hogan's plan. Asks for Chapman's vote. 1p. 23 Nov. 1962.
Scott to Taylor. Re federal conference and dispute with United Stevedoring Co. concerning the issue of industrial clothing. 1p. 30 Nov. 1962.

Ditto. Concerns trouble between AFSA member and a member of Geelong branch WWF in which foremen struck a waterside worker. Contains foreman, Bill Romari's statement. Discusses RMIT rigging and handling course. 4pp. 15 May 1963.
Scott to R. Renton, W.A. Speaks of a WA foreman looking for a job in Melbourne, trouble on Melbourne waterfront, etc. 1p. 1 June 1963.

Scott to Taylor. Concerns a letter from Geelong branch, WWF, which attacks two members of AFSA and speaks of other cases of violence on the waterfront. Also re change of name of employers' organisation from ASIA to AWEL. 3pp. 2, 5 June 1963.
Ditto. Re ACTU Federal conference in Melbourne. Further discussion of physical attacks on the waterfront. 1p. 1 Aug. 1963.
GROUP 3.
CORRESPONDENCE (cont.)
